revision.text:
{{Infobox comedian | name = W. Kamau Bell | image = W. Kamau Bell.jpg | imagesize = | caption = W. Kamau Bell in 2016 | pseudonym = | birth_name = Walter Kamau Bell | birth_date = {{birth date and age|1973|1|26|mf=yes}} | birth_place = [[Palo Alto, California]], [[United States|U.S.]]{{cite news |last=Tedder |first=Michael |url= https://www.buzzfeed.com/michaeltedder/w-kamau-bell-is-trying-to-become-a-thing#.cvd1VMD6x |title=W. Kamau Bell Is Trying To Become A Thing |work=[[Buzzfeed]] |date=2013-09-12 |accessdate=}} | medium = [[Stand up comedian|Stand-up]] [[comedy]] | nationality = [[United States|American]] | active = | genre = | subject = [[Racism]], [[social identity]], [[social inequality|inequality]], American politics | influences = | influenced = [[Zahra Noorbakhsh]] | spouse = Melissa Hudson Bell{{cite web|url=http://www.berkeleyside.com/2015/03/16/at-community-forum-in-berkeley-w-kamau-bell-and-elmwood-cafe-launch-implicit-bias-training-initiative/|work=Berkeleyside|title=At community forum in Berkeley, W. Kamau Bell and Elmwood Café launch 'implicit bias' training initiative|date=March 16, 2015|first=Tracey|last=Taylor}} | children = Sami Bell (daughter)
Juno Bell (daughter){{cite web|url=http://bossip.com/1098464/race-matters-comedian-kamau-bell-told-to-scram-by-waitress-while-socializing-with-his-white-wife-and-her-friends/|title=Race Matters: Comedian Kamau Bell Told To 'Scram' By Waitress While Socializing With His White Wife And Her Friends|date=February 2, 2015}} | notable_work= ''[[Totally Biased with W. Kamau Bell]]'', ''[[United Shades of America]]'', ''[[Denzel Washington Is The Greatest Actor Of All Time Period]]'' | signature = | website = {{url|http://wkamaubell.com}} | footnotes = | parents = [[Walter Bell (businessman)|Walter Bell]]
Janet Cheatham Bell }} '''Walter Kamau Bell''' (born January 26, 1973),{{cite web |author=California Birth Index |title=Walter K Bell, Born 01/26/1973 in California |url=http://www.californiabirthindex.org/birth/walter_k_bell_born_1973_11856509 |publisher=California Birth Index |accessdate=May 10, 2016}} known professionally as '''W. Kamau Bell''', is an American [[stand-up comic]] and [[television host]].{{cite web|url=http://www.breitbart.com/big-journalism/2015/03/10/cnn-adds-reza-aslan-w-kamau-bell-to-cable-line-up/|work=[[Breitbart.com]]|title=CNN Adds Reza Aslan, W. Kamau Bell to Cable Line Up|first=Warner Todd|last=Huston|date=10 Mar 2015}} Prominent within the [[San Francisco]] stand-up comedy scene, he is best known as the host of the CNN original series ''[[United Shades of America]]'' and of the former [[FXX]] television series ''[[Totally Biased with W. Kamau Bell]]''.{{Cite web|title = W. Kamau Bell on Twitter|url = https://twitter.com/wkamaubell/status/691054029036658688|website = Twitter|access-date = 2016-01-24}} He is the host of the live radio show and podcast ''Kamau Right Now'' on [[KALW]], and also co-hosts the podcasts ''[[Denzel Washington Is The Greatest Actor Of All Time Period]]'' with [[Kevin Avery (comedian)|Kevin Avery]] and ''[[Politically Re-Active]]'' with [[Hari Kondabolu]].{{Cite web|url=http://www.earwolf.com/show/denzel-washington/|title=Denzel Washington Is The Greatest Actor Of All Time Period podcast on Earwolf|website=www.earwolf.com|access-date=2016-06-29}}{{Cite web|url=http://www.politicallyreactive.com/|title=Home|website=Politically Re-Active|access-date=2016-06-29}} ==Early life and education== Bell grew up in Alabama, Boston and Chicago, the son of [[Walter Bell (businessman)|Walter Bell]], who served as Alabama's [[Insurance commissioner|Insurance Commissioner]] and Chairman of [[Swiss Re]] America Holding Corporation, and author Janet Cheatham Bell, who founded a self-publishing firm.{{Cite web|url=http://articles.philly.com/2013-07-12/news/40516514_1_fxx-chicago-laboratory-schools-one-man-show|title=Comic Bell brings his total bias here|website=philly-archives|access-date=2016-04-22|archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20150915135437/http://articles.philly.com/2013-07-12/news/40516514_1_fxx-chicago-laboratory-schools-one-man-show|archivedate=15 September 2015}}{{Cite web|url=http://www.theclimategroup.org/what-we-do/interviews/walter-bell/|title=The Clean Revolution is achievable and essential|website=www.theclimategroup.org|access-date=2016-04-22|archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20150906130840/https://www.theclimategroup.org/what-we-do/interviews/walter-bell/|archivedate=6 September 2015}} Between ages five and 12, Bell lived in [[Boston]], [[Massachusetts]] in the [[Mattapan]] neighborhood of the city.{{Cite web|url=http://www.bostonmagazine.com/arts-entertainment/blog/2016/10/14/w-kamau-bell-boston-trump/|title=W. Kamau Bell on Growing Up in Boston, Donald Trump's Rise, and Tom Brady|website=Boston Magazine|access-date=2016-10-15}} Bell graduated from the [[University of Chicago Laboratory Schools]] and attended the [[University of Pennsylvania]] before dropping out. Later he began to pursue a career in comedy.[http://www.avclub.com/article/w-kamau-bell-bruce-lee-and-why-he-didnt-know-jimi--236560W. Kamau Bell on Bruce Lee and why he didn’t know Jimi Hendrix was black] AV Club. He is [[Cousin#1stOnceRem|first cousin once removed]] of speculative fiction writer [[N. K. Jemisin]].Bell, W. Kamau. ''The Awkward Thoughts of W. Kamau Bell''. New York, NY: Dutton, 2017. pp. 24, 28. {{ISBN|978-1-101-98587-8}}. == Career == After establishing himself as a sociopolitical comedian and community activist based in San Francisco, Bell became a founding member of the comedy collective [[Laughter Against the Machine]] and has been featured in a number of prominent podcasts and publications, such as ''[[WTF with Marc Maron]]'', ''[[Citizen Radio]]'', and [[Current TV]]'s ''[[The War Room with Jennifer Granholm]]'', on which Bell was a regular correspondent. His first [[comedy album]], ''One Night Only'', was released in 2007. Also in 2007, he developed a [[One-person show|one-man show]] entitled ''The W. Kamau Bell Curve: Ending Racism in About An Hour'', "a comedic exploration of the current state of America’s racism", which he periodically performs in updated versions.{{Cite web|url=https://thebottomline.as.ucsb.edu/2015/02/ending-racism-in-about-an-hour-with-w-kamau-bell|title=Ending Racism in About an Hour with W. Kamau Bell |work=The Bottom Line|last=Lemon|first=Bryn|date=2015-02-11|access-date=2016-06-29}}{{Cite web|url=http://www.wkamaubell.com/calendar/2016/3/24/st-paul-mn-the-w-kamau-bell-curve-ending-racism-in-about-an-hour|title=St. Paul, MN – Presenting 'The W. Kamau Bell Curve: Ending Racism in about an Hour'|website=W. Kamau Bell|access-date=2016-06-29}} His follow-up album, ''Face Full of Flour'', was released in 2010, and was named one of the Top 10 Best Comedy Albums of the year by [[iTunes]] and ''Punchline Magazine''.{{Cite web|url=http://tempeimprov.com/event.cfm?id=335501|title=W. Kamau Bell|website=tempeimprov.com|access-date=2016-06-29|quote=Kamau has also released two stand-up comedy CD's, ONE NIGht ONLY & Face Full of Flour which was named one of the Ten Best Comedy Albums of 2010 by both iTunes & Punchline Magazine.}} From 2011 to 2012, he wrote the blog "Kamau's Komedy Korner" for the ''[[San Francisco Weekly]]''.{{Cite web|url=http://www.sfweekly.com/sanfrancisco/ArticleArchives?author=2317616|title=San Francisco News and Events |work=SF Weekly|access-date=2016-06-29}} In 2012, Bell was voted San Francisco's best comedian by the [[SF Weekly]], the [[San Francisco Bay Guardian]], and [[7x7 (magazine)|7×7 Magazine]].{{Cite web|url=http://www.huffingtonpost.com/author/w-kamau-bell|title=W. Kamau Bell|website=www.huffingtonpost.com|access-date=2016-06-29|quote=}} His first stand-up comedy [[Television special|TV special]], ''Semi-Prominent Negro'', premiered on Showtime on April 29, 2016,{{Cite web|url=http://www.sho.com/titles/3429029/w-kamau-bell-semi-prominent-negro|title=W. Kamau Bell: Semi-Prominent Negro {{!}} SHOWTIME|website=SHO.com|access-date=2016-06-29}} and on September 30, 2016, his third full-length album, also titled ''Semi-Prominent Negro'', was released on [[Kill Rock Stars]].{{cite web|title=W. KAMAU BELL 'SEMI-PROMINENT NEGRO' OUT NOW ON CD & MP3!|url=http://www.killrockstars.com/news/w-kamau-bell-'semi-prominent-negro'-out-now-on-cd-mp3|date=1 October 2016}} On November 7, 2017, Bell became the Frank Sinatra Artist-in-Residence of Santa Clara University in Santa Clara, California.{{cite news|url=http://www.mercurynews.com/2017/10/05/kamau-w-bell-named-santa-clara-university-artist-in-residence/|title=W. Kamau Bell named Santa Clara University artist in residence |publisher=[[Mercury News]]|date=October 5, 2017|access-date=2017-11-08|author=Chuck Barney}} === Television host === From 2012 to 2013, Bell hosted a weekly [[Stand-up comedy|stand up comedy]] television series, ''[[Totally Biased with W. Kamau Bell]]'', first on FX and later on FXX.{{cite web|work=[[Los Angeles Times]]|url=http://articles.latimes.com/2013/nov/13/entertainment/la-et-st-chris-rockproduced-totally-biased-with-wkamau-bell-canceled-20131113|title=Chris Rock's 'Totally Biased with W. Kamau Bell' canceled|date=November 13, 2013|first=Greg|last=Braxton}} The show, produced by [[Chris Rock]], provided [[observational comedy]] and commentary on social and political issues in addition to celebrity interviews. After the show was cancelled in November 2013, Bell moved back to California from New York.{{cite web|last1=Sale|first1=Anna|title=W. Kamau Bell Wonders How Much Is Enough|url=http://www.wnyc.org/story/w-kamau-bell-death-sex-money/|website=Death, Sex & Money|publisher=wnyc.org|accessdate=2 July 2015|ref=wnyc}} He is currently the host of the [[CNN]] documentary series ''[[United Shades of America]]'', which premiered on April 24, 2016 and was renewed for a third season in 2017. The show, of which Bell is an Executive Producer, was awarded the Creative Arts Emmy for Outstanding Unstructured Reality Program in 2017. === Podcast host === From 2010 to 2014, Bell co-hosted the podcast ''The Field Negro Guide to Arts & Culture'' with [[Living Colour]] guitarist [[Vernon Reid]].{{Cite web|url=http://thatfnpod.libsyn.com/|title=The Field Negro Guide to Arts and Culture w/ Vernon Reid and W. Kamau Bell|website=thatfnpod.libsyn.com|access-date=2016-06-29}} Since November 2014, Bell has co-hosted the [[Earwolf]]-produced podcast ''[[Denzel Washington Is The Greatest Actor Of All Time Period]]'' with comedian and writer [[Kevin Avery (comedian)|Kevin Avery]].{{Cite web|url=http://www.earwolf.com/show/denzel-washington/|title=Denzel Washington Is The Greatest Actor Of All Time Period podcast on Earwolf|website=www.earwolf.com|access-date=2016-05-08}} In addition to reviewing the films of Denzel Washington one by one, the podcast has also featured interviews with prominent actors, filmmakers, musicians, and comedians including [[Spike Lee]],{{Cite web|url=http://www.earwolf.com/episode/54-spike-lee/|title=Spike Lee: Another Thing People Don't Know, episode #57 of Denzel Washington Is The Greatest Actor Of All Time Period on Earwolf|website=www.earwolf.com|access-date=2016-05-08}} [[Ava DuVernay]],{{Cite web|url=http://www.earwolf.com/episode/48-mo-better-blues-w-ava-duvernay/|title=Mo' Better Blues w/ Ava Duvernay, episode #50 of Denzel Washington Is The Greatest Actor Of All Time Period on Earwolf|website=www.earwolf.com|access-date=2016-05-08}} [[Jesse Williams (actor)|Jesse Williams]],{{Cite web|url=http://www.earwolf.com/episode/jesse-williams-of-greys-anatomy/|title=Jesse Williams of Grey's Anatomy, episode #70 of Denzel Washington Is The Greatest Actor Of All Time Period on Earwolf|website=www.earwolf.com|access-date=2016-05-08}} [[Issa Rae]],{{Cite web|url=http://www.earwolf.com/episode/devil-in-a-blue-dress-with-issa-rae/|title=Devil in a Blue Dress with Issa Rae, episode #69 of Denzel Washington Is The Greatest Actor Of All Time Period on Earwolf|website=www.earwolf.com|access-date=2016-05-08}} and [[Ryan Coogler]].{{Cite web|url=http://www.earwolf.com/episode/57-creed-w-ryan-coogler-aaron-covington/|title=Creed w/ Ryan Coogler, Aaron Covington, episode #57 of Denzel Washington Is The Greatest Actor Of All Time Period on Earwolf|website=www.earwolf.com|access-date=2016-05-08}} Since January 2016, he has hosted ''Kamau Right Now'', a live radio show and podcast produced by [[KALW]].{{Cite web|url=http://kalw.org/programs/kamau-right-now#stream/0|title=Kamau Right Now!|access-date=2016-06-29}} Since June 2016, he has also co-hosted the [[Panoply Media|Panoply]]/[[First Look Media]]-produced podcast ''Politically Re-Active'' with comedian [[Hari Kondabolu]]. The podcast explores American politics and elections with a comedic approach, and includes interviews with activists, journalists, and scholars such as [[Ian Haney-López]], [[Robert Reich]], and [[Pramila Jayapal]].{{Cite web|url=https://itunes.apple.com/us/podcast/politically-re-active-w.-kamau/id1125018164|title=Politically Re-Active with W. Kamau Bell & Hari Kondabolu by First Look Media / Panoply on iTunes|website=iTunes|access-date=2016-06-29}} === Author === Bell has authored a number of essays and blog posts about race and racism in American politics and media. In May 2017, Bell published his first book,''The Awkward Thoughts of W. Kamau Bell: Tales of a 6'4, African American, Heterosexual, Cisgender, Left-Leaning, Asthmatic, Black and Proud Blerd, Mama's Boy, Dad, and Stand-Up Comedian''.{{Cite news|url=https://www.publishersweekly.com/978-1-101-98587-8|title=Nonfiction Book Review: The Awkward Thoughts of W. Kamau Bell: Tales of a 6'4, African-American, Heterosexual, Cisgender, Left-Leaning, Asthmatic, Black, and Proud Blerd, Mama’s Boy, Dad, and Stand-Up Comedian by W. Kamau Bell. Dutton, $28 (320p) ISBN 978-1-101-98587-8|work=PublishersWeekly.com|access-date=2018-07-16|language=en}} The book is a humorous autobiography interspersed with essays about politics and popular culture. == Activism == Bell sits on the advisory boards of [[Race Forward]], a racial justice think tank (formerly known as the Applied Research Center), and [[Hollaback!]], an anti-harassment organization.{{Cite web|url=http://www.wkamaubell.com/bio/|title=Bio|website=W. Kamau Bell|access-date=2016-05-08}} In October 2013, he was named the [[American Civil Liberties Union]] celebrity ambassador on racial justice.{{cite web |url= https://www.aclu.org/ambassadors |title= ACLU Ambassadors – W. Kamau Bell |publisher=Aclu.olrg (American Civil Liberties Union) |accessdate=2015-01-05}} === Implicit bias incident in 2015 === On January 26, 2015, Bell and his wife Melissa were involved in an incident at the Elmwood Cafe in [[Berkeley, California]], which Bell alleged was racially motivated.http://www.berkeleyside.com/2015/01/29/comedian-w-kamau-bell-reports-being-subject-of-racism-at-berkeleys-elmwood-cafe An employee of the cafe told Bell to "scram", or words to that effect, while he was talking to his white wife and her friends at one of its outdoor tables.https://www.berkeleyside.com/2015/01/29/comedian-w-kamau-bell-reports-being-subject-of-racism-at-berkeleys-elmwood-cafe The cafe owner and Bell held a community forum to discuss [[implicit bias]] and how to improve.http://www.berkeleyside.com/2015/03/16/at-community-forum-in-berkeley-w-kamau-bell-and-elmwood-cafe-launch-implicit-bias-training-initiative Bell's account was eventually featured in an episode of the radio series ''[[This American Life]]'' entitled ''Birds & Bees''.{{cite web|work=[[This American Life]]|title=557: Birds & Bees Transcript|date=May 15, 2015|url=http://www.thisamericanlife.org/radio-archives/episode/557/transcript}} After a [[Criticism of Starbucks#Philadelphia arrests|similar incident]] resulted in the arrests of two black men at a [[Starbucks]] in April 2018, Bell renewed his criticism of the Elmwood Cafe, and it closed shortly thereafter.http://www.berkeleyside.com/2018/04/20/elmwood-cafe-closed-as-2015-racism-charge-gets-new-life-with-starbucks-arresthttp://www.berkeleyside.com/2018/04/20/opinion-whatever-the-reason-it-closed-the-elmwood-cafe-missed-a-real-opportunity-to-be-a-force-for-change-in-berkeleyhttp://www.berkeleyside.com/2018/04/20/after-closure-elmwood-cafe-owner-says-worker-co-op-nonprofit-could-take-over ==Discography== *2007: ''One Night Only'' *2010: ''Face Full of Flour'' *2016: ''Semi-Prominent Negro''{{cite web|url=https://www.pastemagazine.com/articles/2016/08/w-kamau-bell-announces-new-album-release-tour-date.html|title=W. Kamau Bell Announces New Stand-up Album, Semi-Prominent Negro|author=Cameron Wade|date=August 23, 2016|publisher=Paste Magazine|accessdate=2016-09-13}} ==References== {{reflist|30em}} == External links == * {{official website|http://wkamaubell.com}} * {{IMDb name|4826314}} {{Authority control}} {{DEFAULTSORT:Bell, W. Kamau}} [[Category:1973 births]] [[Category:African-American stand-up comedians]] [[Category:American stand-up comedians]] [[Category:American television talk show hosts]] [[Category:African-American comedians]] [[Category:African-American television hosts]] [[Category:American comedy writers]] [[Category:Late night television talk show hosts]] [[Category:Living people]] [[Category:People from Chicago]] [[Category:Place of birth missing (living people)]] [[Category:University of Pennsylvania alumni]] [[Category:University of Chicago Laboratory Schools alumni]] [[Category:Comedians from Illinois]] [[Category:21st-century American comedians]]
